entry.content:
Things we see will change if we tell ourselves a different story.

We usually tell the story to ourselves, which makes us feel special; in the story in which everyone loves us, I am the one, To whom everyone should care about.

Things we see will change if we tell ourselves a different story. 

We have justification for all the moves we have made. Sometimes we create false assumptions to justify our desires and the things we have done.

Things we see will change if we tell ourselves a different story. 

We made false assumptions to justify ourselves so we would be the good person in our story. Sometimes these stories are very far from the truth. But when we realize that it makes us break and cross, it puts us on the ground. Thoughts and observations collide with the need to update our beliefs.

Things we see will change if we tell ourselves a different story. 

These assumptions we made to justify ourselves. Through this, we form our personality. Since we want to be good in that story { we told ourselves}. We have to behave according to the assumptions we have made. There are some examples of these assumptions.

  1. I love you
  2. I hate you
  3. I am dumb
  4. We are friends
  5. I have a high temper
  6. Yes, but I am like that
  7. I am introvert
  8. I don't go and talk first

and many more...

Things we see will change if we tell ourselves a different story. 

So what do we do?

So what is the story I should tell ourselves?

I don't know the answer, and I don't know that we should tell this story ourselves.

Why should we have to tell a story to ourselves in the first place? 

I want you to think. Why did we tell stories to ourselves why?

entry.content:
This is the list of questions that makes me carry on. 

  1. Why do we exist? 

  2. Do People Have Free Will? 

  3. Is Nature Moving Towards Dissolution Or Integration?

  4. What Gives Life Its Meaning?

  5. Why Do We Create Art?

  6. Does Time Have A Beginning Or An End?

  7. Is Our Universe 'Real'?

  8. How Do You Explain Consciousness?

  9. What, Exactly, Makes You… You?

  10. If The Only Thing I Know Is That I Know Nothing, Do I Know Something?

  11.  If I Were Omnipotent, Could I Create A Rock So Heavy I Couldn't Lift It?

  12. If Every Cell In My Body Gets Replaced Over 7 Years, Will I Still Be Me In 7 Years?

  13. If No One Observes An Event, Did It Happen?

  14. Why is there something rather than nothing?
